controller

Class GameController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.GameController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class GameController
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The controller for a game. Is responsible for delegating most of the gameplay. Sends messages to map, Saves Data, Loads Data, sets up players, calculate which map is needed, sends messages to the enemy team factory, etc.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        col - the col

      • gameOver

        public boolean gameOver()
        Checks both of the player's aliveUnits to see if all of their units are dead. If either of them are out of units they can move, return true and end the game. Checked after every move and attack.
        Returns:
        if the game is over or not

      • checkWinConditions

        public boolean checkWinConditions()
        Determine if a game of a particular type has been won. Sends the relevant information to the right file to check.
        Returns:
        Depending on the game type, if the game has been won

        public int getTurns()
        Get the number of turns gone through in the game.
        Returns:
        the number of turns taken in game

      • unitDoNothing

        public void unitDoNothing()
        This method is used when a player wants to do nothing and end that current unit's turn. Doesn't end the entire turn, just the turn of the currently selected unit.

      • getMap

        public Map getMap()
        Return the map. Used in setting up the GUI with the current game.
        Returns:
        the map of the current game

      • endTurn

        public void endTurn()
        When called, ends a turn. Checks to see whose turn it is, clears the temporary unit list, sets the current unit to null. Sets the can move to false.

      • setCanMove

        private void setCanMove(int row,
                        int col)
        Decides if the current unit can move onto a surrounding space. Called twice, before and after a move/attack.
        Parameters:
        row - the row
        col - the col

      • targetDead

        private void targetDead(int row,
                        int col)
        Checks to see if a specific unit is dead. If it is, remove it from the map and from the alive unit lists in the associated team.
        Parameters:
        row - the row
        col - the col

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Checks to see if the game is over. If it is, return true;
        Returns:
        if the game is over or not

      • playerWon

        public boolean playerWon()
        Called upon to check if the player has won. Returns true if the player wins the game.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the game has won

      • playerTurn

        public boolean playerTurn()
        Checks to see if the Player is currently moving. If the player is, return true.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the player is moving.

      • getPlayerUnits

        public java.util.List<Unit> getPlayerUnits()
        Gets the point locations of all of the player locations. Used with enemy AI, gives them a list of targets that they can move to.
        Returns:
        A List of Points with all of the locations of monsters.

      • enemyTurn

        public void enemyTurn()
        The method used to go through the enemy units. Moves or attacks them.

        Attacks the nearest unit. Used by the AI.
        Parameters:

        col - the col
        rangeLeft - the range left
        Returns:
        true, if successful

      • enemyMove

        public void enemyMove(java.awt.Point em)
        Automatically moves the enemy AI. Moves them toward the closest human based on their behavior. If they are near enough to a player's unit, attack.
        Parameters:
        em - the em

      • nearestPlayerUnit

        public java.awt.Point nearestPlayerUnit(java.awt.Point enemyLoc)
        Finds the nearest player location point closest to an enemy unit. Returns the nearest point based on how many moves would be needed to make it.
        Parameters:
        enemyLoc - the enemy loc
        Returns:
        the point
